threePillars.title: The Blueprint for a Regenerative World
threePillars.intro: Our world faces interconnected crises that require a new way of thinking and organizing. The Global Governance Frameworks provide a comprehensive, open-source blueprint for this transformation, built upon three integrated pillars:

pillar1.label: The Hardware
pillar1.title: The Treaty for Our Only Home
pillar1.description: The legal and institutional foundation for effective global action. The Treaty reforms core international bodies and establishes enforceable international law, creating the stable structure needed to make change possible.

pillar2.label: The Heart
pillar2.title: Indigenous & Traditional Knowledge Governance
pillar2.description: The ethical and philosophical compass for the entire ecosystem. It centers the wisdom of Right Relationship and Indigenous sovereignty, ensuring that our solutions are not just effective, but also just, wise, and truly regenerative.

pillar3.label: The Nervous System
pillar3.title: The Integrated Meta-Governance Framework
pillar3.description: The coordination protocol that allows all parts of the system to work together. It provides the principles and structures for different frameworks and communities to interoperate, creating a flexible and adaptive network that can evolve with our challenges.

integration.title: How It Works Together: A Living System
integration.flow1: The Indigenous Framework provides the guiding WHY
integration.flow2: The Treaty provides the foundational WHAT and WHERE
integration.flow3: The Meta-Governance provides the operational HOW
integration.note: This core architecture enables the development and deployment of specific, domain-level solutions across climate, economics, health, technology, and all areas of planetary stewardship.

featuredFramework.heading: From Vision to Action: The Aegis Protocol
featuredFramework.intro: The vision of 'Unity Beyond the Known' becomes reality through The Aegis Protocol—a transformative framework that redirects our $2.7 trillion global military spending toward planetary defense, cosmic exploration, and species-level cooperation.
featuredFramework.point1: Transforms military budgets into funding for asteroid defense, climate security, and interstellar exploration missions
featuredFramework.point2: Creates the prestigious Earth Defense Force (EDF), giving major powers a unifying mission beyond terrestrial competition
featuredFramework.point3: Ensures just transition through AUBI support, retraining programs, and dignified career paths for defense personnel
featuredFramework.point4: Builds 'Unity Beyond the Known' through shared cosmic threats that make human cooperation not idealistic, but strategic
featuredFramework.highlight: This is how we get from $2.7T in military spending to $2.7T in planetary stewardship—not through wishful thinking, but through systematic transformation.
featuredFramework.ctaSubtitle: See the complete roadmap for transforming global security

emergingPossibilities.heading: Emerging Global Possibilities
emergingPossibilities.intro: We're witnessing promising developments that create new pathways for effective global governance:

possibilities.title: Global Digital Commons
possibilities.description: Digital technologies are enabling unprecedented coordination across borders. Citizens worldwide now connect, organize, and develop solutions in real-time, creating informal governance networks that often work faster than formal institutions.

possibilities.title: Successful Transnational Frameworks
possibilities.description: Initiatives like the Paris Climate Accord show that nations can align on critical planetary challenges. These frameworks demonstrate that with sufficient shared interest, global cooperation is not only possible but increasingly necessary.

possibilities.title: Bottom-Up Governance Innovations
possibilities.description: Communities worldwide are experimenting with participatory democracy, digital decision-making, and collaborative resource management—creating working models that could scale to broader levels.

possibilities.title: Crisis-Driven Collaboration
possibilities.description: Shared challenges like climate change, pandemics, and AI risks are creating both the necessity and opportunity for deeper global cooperation, accelerating governance innovation to address common threats.

additionalInfo.heading: Why We Need Meta-Governance
additionalInfo.paragraph1: The world has numerous governance experiments happening at different scales, but they often operate in isolation. We need frameworks that allow these innovations to connect, share lessons, and evolve together.
additionalInfo.paragraph2: Global Governance Frameworks provides tools and patterns for:
listItems: Enabling governance to evolve to higher levels of consciousness
Supporting both direct democracy and international cooperation
additionalInfo.paragraph3: Our approach draws on systems thinking, Spiral Dynamics, and practical experience to create governance systems that are both efficient and deeply considerate of human values.
